traceability.evidence: • test/filter-by-security-severity.test.js: verifies filterBySecurity blocks or allows versions correctly for thresholds 'low', 'moderate', 'high', 'critical', 'none'. • test/cli.flags.test.js: CLI rejects invalid --severity values (exit code 2), rejects missing value, defaults to 'none', and correctly parses each valid level, reflecting it in JSON output summary.thresholds. • src/config-loader.js: loadConfigFile validates config.severity against ['none','low','moderate','high','critical'] and config support is exercised by test/cli.config-file.test.js. • src/cli-options.js & cli-options-helpers: parseSeverityFlag integrates CLI flag, config value, and precedence (CLI > config > default). • bin/dry-aged-deps.js printHelp(): includes --severity option with valid levels. • JSON/XML output (json-formatter.js, xml-formatter.js) include thresholds.summary.thresholds.minSeverity, showing applied threshold. All severity‐threshold acceptance criteria are implemented and covered by tests.
traceability.notes: The implementation fully satisfies the configurable security threshold story (006.0) with CLI flag, config file support, correct default, validation, override behavior, filtering logic, and documentation. The existing tests provide end‐to‐end coverage of all acceptance criteria.
